intro: Angelonia blanchetii, commonly known as the African angelonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches, making it an attractive ornamental plant. Angelonia blanchetii is well-suited for gardens and can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
